title: Why talons passive?
body: Nice and short. Why  Is there  a passive that looks like it was suppose to go on a dps champ, on a burst ad caster?  After   level 6+ on talon it does not  seem as useful.  They tend to die from your kills and one/two autos if even that not counting your q. Was there no other idea for his passive? I hope it will be addressed in the assassin update.

replies.body:
Frankly it's a bad passive on anyone. It's not a high enough value to be very meaningful choice wise. Even on a really auto attack centric champion it wouldn't add much gameplay at 10%, given you generally want to CC people you're auto attacking anyway. 

It's not appropriate to just buff it on Talon though until it's relevant, given he's not weak. We'd have to strip power out of other parts of his kit to do so. Instead it's a prime opportunity to just do something better. I expect that, regardless of whether Talon's one of the assassins we do bigger changes to or just one who gets smaller changes, that we'll give him a new passive in the pre-season update.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackGuilmon,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RrZRNm0G,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2016-07-07T20:12:08.764+0000)
>
> Every 3 AA on an isolated target deal 10% missing hp physical damage?

Talon is not an auto attack reliant champion, he is an AD caster, a champion that relies mostly on their spells to deal damage, not so much auto attacks. Ezreal, Lucian and Kha'Zix are all similar in this way.

Isolation is Kha'Zix's thing. Slapping the same type of mechanic onto another champion just makes both characters less unique and more bland.

10% missing hp physical damage is a boatload of extra damage onto an enemy, especially since Talon will typically do his jump, q, w, ult or ult, w. This usually almost always overkills the champions he is going for which are squishy supports or carry champions with little health. Since his primary targets are squishies and he usually overkills them anyways, this type of 10% execution damage would overkill even more, if not, it would almost certainly grant him a kill. 

If I was Riot I'd look to create a Passive that rewards him for killing people. In his lore it pretty much states that he was a robber and got in and out quickly. It's similar to his playstyle. E in = getting in quickly. Q and W= slow the enemy down. Finally, R= deal a ton of damage quickly and the bonus movement speed lets him get out quickly.

The passive needs to support his in and out playstyle.
I hope with this passive you dont ruin him the way you ruined malzahar, brand, ect. (no hate)

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RrZRNm0G,comment-id=000200030000,timestamp=2016-07-07T21:15:33.193+0000)
>
> I thought people liked Brand's new passive.....

It's interesting and can be powerful in the right situations, but Brand had a lot of power stripped all over his kit to have the new gimmick (same as Malzahar). 

Q = base damage **and** ratio nerfed + stun duration reduced.  
E = base damage **and** ratio nerfed.
R = base damage **and** ratio nerfed. (No one cares about the pitiful slow added to it while Rylai's is a core item.)
Passive = tick damage nerfed. 

For Brand to deal close to the same damage as before, he has to proc the new gimmick. That aspect about him doesn't feel good. Especially the fact that Riot doesn't even realize that all it takes is one MR item to make a mage no better than a CC support. 
I recently played against a Zed as Malzahar who rushed Maw. I could barely do any damage to Zed. Even with me having Seeker's, he still did more damage because AD > AP.

As someone who plays Brand (and Malzahar) often, it's painful to see mages who were just fine pre-MYMU be ruined by overnerfing ("_New gimmicks are scary! I don't know how to buy MR! WAHHH!_"), all the while some marks(wo)men also get new gimmicks, but instead of nerfs get a boatload of buffs, kit-wise and item-wise. Champions who were already strong before their big marks(wo)men update. The AD favoritism is disgusting.

> The AD favoritism is disgusting.

{{item:3053}} ? {{item:3075}} ?{{item:3110}} ?

> [{quoted}](name=TyrekGoldenspear,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RrZRNm0G,comment-id=00020003000000010000,timestamp=2016-07-08T02:30:37.850+0000)

You really want to do this?

{{item:3105}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3155}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3211}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3091}} 

{{item:3060}} MR for team + promoted minions are **immune to all magic damage**.

_"But what about the CC?!"_

You mean the debuffs AD champions have just as much of? Sure, mages can provide utility if they are countered with one of many MR items readily available for everyone but particularly AD champions, but then you realize...

{{item:3111}} {{item:3140}}  {{item:3139}} {{item:3102}} {{item:2138}} {{summoner:1}} 

There are many counters to CC and mages have no way of getting around any of them.

"_But, but, but--_ {{item:3075}}"

{{item:1053}} alone negates its relevance, and there are a ton of sustain options for AD champions to choose from.

"{{item:3110}} _!!!_"

A minuscule AS reduction and virtually no armor while {{item:3071}}  {{item:3033}} {{item:3036}} exist.

"_Durr_... {{item:3053}}"

Why did you list that item?

---

The two differences in the two damage types are sustain and right-click power. One has both, while the other has neither. 
The only way an AP champion is allowed to have either is through gimmicks.

{{champion:17}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:99}} 

As some examples.

You'd think only AP champions have these nifty and interesting right-click gimmicks.
Well...

{{champion:39}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:51}} 

That's not the case.

Mages really have no place in this game anymore. AD champions can do anything AP champions can, and usually better at that. Riot secretly hates cooldown-based gameplay and therefore wants AD champions to always shine the brightest because they **all** have inherent right-click power + flashy skills + tons of mobility if they get Black Cleaver. AP champions just have flashy skills. Right-clicking has no real cooldown and always has relevance in damage on **all** AD champions. That leads to more action and excitement in the LCS. It's not exciting waiting on mages with their cooldowns.

Why do you think marks(wo)men got such a sweet deal when they had their big update, while the affected mages got unwanted gimmicks and nerfs to kits and items?

Why do you think they want {{champion:268}} to remain strong while nerfing {{champion:90}} into the ground? Azir is a right-clicker for the mid lane. He consistently provides action. Malzahar is hindered by cooldowns (and high mana costs). Not exciting. 
Sure, Azir has been nerfed a bit since then, but noticed how he was left out of the MYMU? Azir is what Riot wants with their mages. Despite the nerfs, he's still incredibly strong. Meanwhile, they want to reduce Malzahar's basic attack range to 500 (wtf?) and nerf his MS. 

A champion with **0 mobility and 0 disengage** needs to have much less MS than {{champion:64}}'s 350. 

The message from Riot is right there, clear to see. Malzahar's MS is already low, **all things considered**, but _apparently_ not enough. The saddest part about all of it is he's not getting any compensation buffs from it, like having his Q and E actually do damage again.

But sure, let's keep whining about {{champion:45}} ulting one target for 500 damage every ~70 seconds while {{champion:51}} crits for more than 1k damage every second + the occasional Shiv/Firecannon proc damage without expending any mana and healing 100+ health each attack.

Anything else that needs to be covered?
